question: What is significant about the number of people living in Ontario?
possible_answers: A. They make up two-thirds of all Canadians.
B. They make up three-fourths of all Canadians.
C. They make up one-third of all Canadians.
D. They make up half of all Canadians.
main_question: What is significant about the number of people living in Ontario?
answer: C. They make up one-third of all Canadians.
explanatory_sentence: At more than 12 million, the people of Ontario make up more than one-third of Canadians.
